definition: nursing student/(Buddhism) to preserve the lives of all living beings
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The nursing students tented to have a positive attitude towards computers.
sentences.chinese: 护生对电脑的态度是正向的。

sentences.english: Objective To raise the manipulative ability of clinical nursing skills of the college nursing students.
sentences.chinese: 目的提高专科护生临床护理技术操作能力。

sentences.english: To elaborated the clinical teaching situation of nursing students from Finland.
sentences.chinese: 阐述了对来自芬兰护生的临床教学情况。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate probationer nurses' knowledge about nosocomial infection (NI).
sentences.chinese: 目的了解实习护生医院感染知识知晓情况。

sentences.english: Objectives To explore the safety issues in intravenous infusion among nursing students during clinical practice.
sentences.chinese: 目的解决临床实习护生在静脉输液安全中出现的问题。

sentences.english: Method The investigation was conducted on nursing college undergraduates using self-designed questionnaire.
sentences.chinese: 方法采用自设问卷对本科护生进行调查。

definition: to give food (as a charity)/"feeding the hungry ghosts" (Buddhist ceremony)
(Buddhism) to deliver all living creatures from suffering (idiom)
Amitabha Buddha/the Buddha of the Western paradise/may the lord Buddha preserve us!/merciful Buddha!
mercy as the guiding principle (idiom); the Buddhist teaching that nothing is valid except compassion
to be reborn/to live in paradise (Buddhism)/to die/(after) one's death
